metadata.description: Translations and mappings for verses that exist in Latin Vulgate but are missing in English translation

35.latin: Gravia hæc homini habenti sensum : correptio domus, et improperium fœneratoris.
35.english: These things are grievous to a man of understanding: the reproach of house-room, and the insult of the lender.
35.notes: This verse completes the thought from verse 34 about hospitality and debt

50.latin: Da nobis dextras, et cessent Judæi oppugnare nos, et civitatem.
50.english: Give us your pledge, and let the Jews cease from attacking us and the city.
50.notes: This verse is part of the narrative between verses 49-51, where the city inhabitants plead with the king

17.latin: exhortetur corda vestra, et confirmet in omni opere et sermone bono.
17.english: comfort your hearts and strengthen them in every good work and word.
17.notes: This verse completes the sentence from verse 16, which is why it's combined in some English translations
